page.title: 07LANDSCAPE , OPINION
page.content: Looking South, (from North Beck Drain - Ref. O.S. - TA 215153) you can see the S.C.M. chemical works with its tall smokey chimneys. Pipes criss cross each other like a trail of spaghetti and looks rather ugly. Further South are other factories and dominating the horizon is Grimsby Dock Tower. The Northern view is quite different; the oil terminal jetty where ships unload their cargoes and North East is the huge cylindrical oil storage tanks. The estuary itself is a cold grey colour with a pebble beach often stained red. Litter of all kinds can be seen. While walking to the sea we saw a sign that said,{"BEWARE {SULPHURIC ACID".
